str2: From the base of peran; properly, through, i.e. Around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time.
From mesos and hemera; midday; by implication, the south.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Dative Masculine Singular
str2: Trans: I bring near; intrans: I come near, approach. From eggus; to make near, i.e. approach.
Damascus. Of Hebrew origin; Damascus, a city of Syria.
Suddenly, unexpectedly. From ek and the base of aiphnidios; of a sudden.
From hiko; competent, i.e. Ample or fit.
Light, a source of light, radiance. From an obsolete phao; luminousness.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
Perhaps from the same as oros; the sky; by extension, heaven; by implication, happiness, power, eternity; specially, the Gospel.
To flash (gleam) around like lightning. From peri and astrapto; to flash all around, i.e. Envelop in light.
From the base of peran; properly, through, i.e. Around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
